title: Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Meta: Why big techs are investing billions in their new favourite destination - India
description: In the last 48 hours alone, India has secured $52 billion worth of investments from Microsoft and Amazon, underscoring the country's growing importance in the AI map of the world amid the Centre's artificial intelligence push.

title: Maharashtra Becomes First State To Deploy AI Platform For Cybercrime Policing
description: Maharashtra has become the first Indian state to equip its police force with an artificial intelligence-powered platform to speed up cybercrime investigations.
content: Maharashtra has become the first Indian state to equip its police force with an artificial intelligence-powered platform to speed up cybercrime investigations. The AI-driven system, called MahaCrimeOS AI, was unveiled at the Microsoft AI Tour in Mumb... [2867 chars]

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella Says AI Reshaping Innovation Across Sectors
description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said the world is entering a new era where the "frontier of what is possible" is rapidly expanding, driven by advances in artificial intelligence. The CEO shared this during his address at the Microsoft AI Tour in Mumbai.

title: Indian teacher, 2 students named finalists in global prize for AI education work
description: Two students and an educator from India are finalists for the World Education Medals 2025, which spotlight efforts using artificial intelligence to improve access and equity in education.

title: Disney licenses characters to OpenAI, takes $1 billion stake
description: Walt Disney Co. is licensing iconic characters including Mickey Mouse and Cinderella to OpenAI for use on its artificial intelligence video platform and has agreed to take a $1 billion stake in the startup.

title: Trump signs executive order to block state AI laws;'There’ll only be one winner…' | US Vs China
description: On December 11, President Donald Trump held a signing ceremony at the White House, marking a key moment in his administration’s policy agenda. Standing alongside senior officials, Trump emphasized that the action was designed to strengthen the U.S. economy, protect American workers, and deliver “real results for the American people.” The President framed the move as part of his broader effort to restore stability and assert strong leadership at home and abroad. He also highlighted AI as a core pillar of future growth, stressing that the U.S. must lead in artificial intelligence to stay competitive. Reporters pressed Trump on implementation timelines, projected impact, and how the decision aligned with wider national security and economic priorities. | World News
